cons: Salary may be lower than other SW hospital positions in the area Not being able to keep SW's supervisor can sometimes lead to SW advocating for themselves.

review_title: Good place to learn for a new grad nurse
job_title: Registered Nurse in San Jose, CA
pros: You get to work with a very diverse patient population with different culture and socioeconomic backgrounds. Nurses have great autonomy while working, little to no micromanagement from upper managers. High acuity patients so it is good place for new grad to start off with
cons: Short staffing is an ongoing thing and it is quite extreme sometimes. You will likely get mandated overtime, out of ratios, working at shifts that there is no charge nurse, no resource nurse, no CNA, thus no break time.

job_title: Case Manager in San Jose, CA
pros: The director I was under was very flexible but she left.  Close to home.  Their case management department was 24hours due to the trauma unit.  I enjoyed working there.  My department had a great group of people.  The staff through out the company were great and helpful.
cons: Extremely low pay and not competitive with surrounding companies.  High turn over rate with staff due to low wages.  High case load and increase complexity of patients.

review_title: Not a good hospital for learning, nurses are overworked, Hospital is understaffed.
job_title: Nurse in San Jose, CA
pros: Employees work hard and are great at what they do. It is a good facility for a new grad nurse to learn basic skills.
cons: Do not work here if you are used to teaching facilities. It is a step down clinically. Management is intermittent, changes every six months, doesn’t listen to nurses who have seniority and years of experience. There is not much opportunity for educational advancement, unless you decide to go back to school. The workload is heavy, and is borderline unsafe. They need more staff but can’t keep them, there’s lots of travelers.

review_title: I love the job of Trauma ICU, but new upper management makes it difficult to stay on as staff
job_title: Staff RN in San Jose, CA
pros: Educational opportunities are very good.
cons: New upper management not in tune with the needs of current employees.  I feel he thinks everyone can be replaced at his whim

job_title: Physical Therapist in San Jose, CA
pros: Flexible schedule, PTO, good medical/dental/vision benefits. Allowed some paid time to take con ed courses. Has stroke courses for you can take for free.
cons: Meditech computer program for documentation isn't user friendly. Can be challenging to meet productivity goals. No con ed course allowance.

job_title: Manager in San Jose, CA
pros: Staff are like domestic violence victims, placed in horrible conditions time and time again, but stay because they are a team and believe in the small hospital serving a challenging health population.
cons: CEO and the corporate leadership who scrap every dollar from the organization. The CEO is out of touch and surrounds himself with yes-man who are ineffective.
